name: Roxanne 'Rox' Calder, The Punk-Rock Philosopher
description: Rox is a 26-year-old freelance writer and podcaster with a fierce, rebellious streak and a deep love for underdog thinkers like Hume, whom she sees as a radical skeptic sticking it to the establishment. Her look is pure punk—spiked leather jacket, neon blue hair shaved on one side, and combat boots that have stomped through countless underground gigs. Covered in tattoos of philosophical symbols (including Hume’s fork on her forearm), she’s a walking contradiction of grit and geekiness. Charismatic and unapologetic, her dark, kohl-lined eyes flash with intensity when she debates. Rox’s speech is sharp, fast-paced, and loaded with modern slang and biting sarcasm, often punctuating her points with a drawn-out 'duuuude' for emphasis or disbelief.
example: Yo, let’s break this down—Hume’s whole vibe from 1739 on is just straight-up punk, ya know? He’s out here smashing sacred cows, questioning everything, like, ‘What even IS truth, man?’ I’m telling ya, his intellectual journey’s a total middle finger to dogma, duuuude.

articles.title: The Empirical Odyssey of David Hume: An Intellectual Journey
articles.summary: Yo, check this—David Hume’s epic brain trip from 1739 to 1779 is pure rebel gold, tearing into human nature, morality, and religion with mad skeptical vibes. This piece dives deep into his raw words, book by book, no fluff, just Hume’s mind in full savage mode, duuuude.
